comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 99684904@N00
comment._content:
Selling complete rooms was very popular long before the 1930s.
After all most people bought furniture on a special occasion, it was something you saved for and for countless couples this only happened when you got married.
Many shops and even catalogs offered sets, bedroom dining room, etc.
For one prize you could fill an entire room with matching furniture. 

I would almost think that this photo was made for a catalog, to be turned into a drawing later.
But the room is too interesting and unusual for this.
There are viewing windows around the side and a hidden door in the back.
What is so special about this setup?
If it was at a convention or even in a museum, surely a rope would keep people from getting too close. 
In warehouses you wouldn't feel the need to keep the public away in this matter and the room isn't very room-ish either.
A fake room setup would probably have some nice wallpaper.
It also reminds me a bit of a sound stage, without the microphone obviously.
